intro: Hiraea gaudichaudiana f. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandless hiraea, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glandless leaves, which distinguish it from other members of the species. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually displaying a pale yellow or greenish hue. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanical curiosity and of interest to plant enthusiasts and researchers.
